Des Tal
Oa
Crl.MC.No. 3 of 2019 2019 KERIS
2
ORDER

Petition filed under section 482 Cr.P.C.

2. Petitioner is the accused in C.C.No.260
of 2017 on the file of the Judicial Magistrate of
First Class, Chavara registered for the offences
under sections 294(b), 323, 324 and 341 IPC. The
third respondent is the victim. It is submitted that
the matter has been settled and the proceedings in
the trial court may be quashed.

3. Heard the learned counsel for the
petitioner and third respondent and the learned
Public Prosecutor.

4. I have perused the affidavit filed by
the third respondent, who has entered appearance
through counsel. I am satisfied that the matter has
been settled and no public interest is involved in
this case. There is no impediment for granting the
prayer of the petitioners.

In the result, this Crl.M.C is allowed. The
proceedings in C.C.No.260 of 2017 on the file of the

Des Tal

3
Judicial Magistrate of First Class, Chavara are
quashed. If any material objects have been produced
in this case, the trial court may pass appropriate
orders for their disposal.
Sd/-
K.ABRAHAM MATHEW,
JUDGE
